args.name: scope
args.description: (Required) A list of items to apply the downtime to, e.g. host:X

args.name: active
args.description: (Optional) A flag indicating if the downtime is active now.

args.name: disabled
args.description: (Optional) A flag indicating if the downtime was disabled.

args.name: start
args.description: (Optional) POSIX timestamp to start the downtime.

args.name: start_date
args.description: (Optional) String representing date and time to start the downtime in RFC3339 format.

args.name: end
args.description: (Optional) POSIX timestamp to end the downtime.

args.name: end_date
args.description: (Optional) String representing date and time to end the downtime in RFC3339 format.

args.name: recurrence
args.description:
(Optional) A dictionary to configure the downtime to be recurring.


type - days, weeks, months, or years

period - How often to repeat as an integer. For example to repeat every 3 days, select a type of days and a period of 3.

week_days - (Optional) A list of week days to repeat on. Choose from: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat or Sun. Only applicable when type is weeks. First letter must be capitalized.

until_occurrences - (Optional) How many times the downtime will be rescheduled. until_occurrences and until_date are mutually exclusive.

until_date - (Optional) The date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestamp. until_occurrences and until_date are mutually exclusive.

args.name: type
args.description: days, weeks, months, or years

args.name: period
args.description: How often to repeat as an integer. For example to repeat every 3 days, select a type of days and a period of 3.

args.name: week_days
args.description: (Optional) A list of week days to repeat on. Choose from: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat or Sun. Only applicable when type is weeks. First letter must be capitalized.

args.name: until_occurrences
args.description: (Optional) How many times the downtime will be rescheduled. until_occurrences and until_date are mutually exclusive.

args.name: until_date
args.description: (Optional) The date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestamp. until_occurrences and until_date are mutually exclusive.

args.name: message
args.description: (Optional) A message to include with notifications for this downtime.

args.name: monitor_id
args.description: (Optional) Reference to which monitor this downtime is applied. When scheduling downtime for a given monitor, datadog changes silenced property of the monitor  to match the end POSIX timestamp.

args.name: account_id
args.description: (Required) Your AWS Account ID without dashes.

args.name: role_name
args.description: (Required) Your Datadog role delegation name.

args.name: filter_tags
args.description: (Optional) Array of EC2 tags (in the form key:value) defines a filter that Datadog use when collecting metrics from EC2. Wildcards, such as ? (for single characters) and * (for multiple characters) can also be used.

args.name: host_tags
args.description: (Optional) Array of tags (in the form key:value) to add to all hosts and metrics reporting through this integration.

args.name: account_specific_namespace_rules
args.description: (Optional) Enables or disables metric collection for specific AWS namespaces for this AWS account only. A list of namespaces can be found at the available namespace rules API endpoint.

args.name: project_id
args.description: (Required) Your Google Cloud project ID found in your JSON service account key.

args.name: private_key_id
args.description: (Required) Your private key ID found in your JSON service account key.

args.name: private_key
args.description: (Required) Your private key name found in your JSON service account key.

args.name: client_email
args.description: (Required) Your email found in your JSON service account key.

args.name: client_id
args.description: (Required) Your ID found in your JSON service account key.

args.name: host_filters
args.description: (Optional) Limit the GCE instances that are pulled into Datadog by using tags. Only hosts that match one of the defined tags are imported into Datadog.

attrs.name: client_email
attrs.description: Google Cloud project service account email

args.name: metric
args.description: (Required) The name of the metric.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) A description of the metric.

args.name: short_name
args.description: (Optional) A short name of the metric.

args.name: unit
args.description: (Optional) Primary unit of the metric such as 'byte' or 'operation'.

args.name: per_unit
args.description: (Optional) 'Per' unit of the metric such as 'second' in 'bytes per second'.

args.name: statsd_interval
args.description: (Optional) If applicable, stasd flush interval in seconds for the metric.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The type of the monitor, chosen from:


metric alert

service check

event alert

query alert

composite

log alert

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name of Datadog monitor

args.name: query
args.description:
(Required) The monitor query to notify on. Note this is not the same query you see in the UI and
the syntax is different depending on the monitor type, please see the API Reference for details. Warning: terraform plan won't perform any validation of the query contents.

args.name: message
args.description:
(Required) A message to include with notifications for this monitor.
Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same '@username' notation as events.

args.name: escalation_message
args.description:
(Optional) A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the '@username'
notification allowed elsewhere.

args.name: thresholds
args.description:
(Optional)


Metric alerts:
A dictionary of thresholds by threshold type. Currently we have four threshold types for metric alerts: critical, critical recovery, warning, and warning recovery. Critical is defined in the query, but can also be specified in this option. Warning and recovery thresholds can only be specified using the thresholds option.
Example usage:

thresholds = {
    critical          = 90
    critical_recovery = 85
    warning           = 80
    warning_recovery  = 75
}

Warning: the critical threshold value must match the one contained in the query argument. The threshold from the previous example is valid along with a query like avg(last_1h):avg:system.disk.in_use{role:sqlserver} by {host} > 90 but
along with something like avg(last_1h):avg:system.disk.in_use{role:sqlserver} by {host} > 95 would make the Datadog API return a HTTP error 400, complaining "The value provided for parameter 'query' is invalid".

Service checks:
A dictionary of thresholds by status. Because service checks can have multiple thresholds, we don't define them directly in the query.
Default values:

thresholds = {
    ok       = 1
    critical = 1
    warning  = 1
    unknown  = 1
}

args.name: notify_no_data
args.description:
(Optional) A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Defaults
to false.

args.name: new_host_delay
args.description:
(Optional) Time (in seconds) to allow a host to boot and
applications to fully start before starting the evaluation of monitor
results. Should be a non negative integer. Defaults to 300.

args.name: evaluation_delay
args.description:
(Optional, only applies to metric alert) Time (in seconds) to delay evaluation, as a nonnegative integer.
For example, if the value is set to 300 (5min), the timeframe is set to last_5m and the time is 7:00,
the monitor will evaluate data from 6:50 to 6:55. This is useful for AWS CloudWatch and other backfilled
metrics to ensure the monitor will always have data during evaluation.

args.name: no_data_timeframe
args.description:
(Optional) The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Must be at
least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks. Default: 2x timeframe for
metric alerts, 2 minutes for service checks.

args.name: renotify_interval
args.description:
(Optional) The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will renotify
on the current status. It will only re-notify if it's not resolved.

args.name: notify_audit
args.description:
(Optional) A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor.
Defaults to false.

args.name: timeout_h
args.description:
(Optional) The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve
from a triggered state. Defaults to false.

args.name: include_tags
args.description: (Optional) A boolean indicating whether notifications from this monitor will automatically insert its

args.name: enable_logs_sample
args.description:
(Optional) A boolean indicating whether or not to include a list of log values which triggered the alert. Defaults to false. This is only used by log monitors.
triggering tags into the title. Defaults to true.

args.name: require_full_window
args.description:
(Optional) A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated.
We highly recommend you set this to False for sparse metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped.
Default: True for "on average", "at all times" and "in total" aggregation. False otherwise.

args.name: locked
args.description: (Optional) A boolean indicating whether changes to to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins. Defaults to False.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A list of tags to associate with your monitor. This can help you categorize and filter monitors in the manage monitors page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

args.name: threshold_windows
args.description:
(Optional) A mapping containing recovery_window and trigger_window values, e.g. last_15m. Can only be used for anomaly monitors.


recovery_window describes how long an anomalous metric must be normal before the alert recovers.

trigger_window  describes how long a metric must be anomalous before an alert triggers.

args.name: recovery_window
args.description: describes how long an anomalous metric must be normal before the alert recovers.

args.name: trigger_window
args.description: describes how long a metric must be anomalous before an alert triggers.

args.name: silenced
title
args.description: (Required) The name of the screenboard.

args.name: height
args.description: (Optional) The screenboard's height.

args.name: width
args.description: (Optional) The screenboard's width.

args.name: read_only
args.description: (Optional) The read-only status of the screenboard. Default is false.

args.name: shared
args.description: (Optional) Whether the screenboard is shared or not. Default is false.

args.name: widget
args.description: (Required) Nested block describing a widget. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple widget blocks are allowed within a datadog_screenboard resource.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) The type of the widget. One of "free_text", "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", "change", "event_timeline", "event_stream", "image", "note", "alert_graph", "alert_value", "iframe", "check_status", "trace_service", "hostmap", "manage_status", "log_stream", or "process".

args.name: x
args.description: (Required) The position of the widget on the x (vertical) axis. Should be greater or equal to 0.

args.name: y
args.description: (Required) The position of the widget on the y (horizontal) axis. Should be greater or equal to 0.

args.name: title
args.description: (Optional) The title of the widget.

args.name: title_align
args.description: (Optional) The alignment of the widget's title. One of "left", "center", or "right".

args.name: title_size
args.description: (Optional) The size of the widget's title. Default is 16.

args.name: height
args.description: (Optional) The height of the widget. Default is 15.

args.name: width
args.description: (Optional) The width of the widget. Default is 50.

args.name: text
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "free_text") The text to display in the widget.

args.name: color
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "free_text") The color of the text in the widget.

args.name: font_size
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "free_text", "note") The size of the text in the widget.

args.name: text_size
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value") The size of the text in the widget.

args.name: unit
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value") The unit for the value displayed in the widget.

args.name: precision
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value") The precision to use when displaying the value. Use "*" for maximum precision.

args.name: text_align
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "free_text", "alert_value", "note") The alignment of the text in the widget.

args.name: alert_id
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value", "alert_graph") The ID of the monitor used by the widget.

args.name: auto_refresh
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value", "alert_graph") Boolean indicating whether the widget is refreshed automatically.

args.name: legend
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist") Boolean indicating whether to display a legend in the widget.

args.name: legend_size
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist") The size of the legend displayed in the widget.

args.name: query
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "event_timeline", "event_stream", "hostmap", "log_stream") The query to use in the widget.

args.name: url
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "image", "iframe") The URL to use as a data source for the widget.

args.name: viz_type
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_graph") Type of visualization to use when displaying the widget. Either "timeseries" or "toplist".

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") List of tags to use in the widget.

args.name: check
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") The check to use in the widget.

args.name: group
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") The check group to use in the widget.

args.name: grouping
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") Either "check" or "cluster", depending on whether the widget should use a single check or a cluster of checks.

args.name: group_by
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") When grouping = "cluster", indicates a list of tags to use for grouping.

args.name: tick
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") Boolean indicating whether a tick should be displayed on the border of the widget.

args.name: tick_pos
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") When tick = true, string with a percent sign indicating the position of the tick. Example: use tick_pos = "50%" for centered alignment.

args.name: tick_edge
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") When tick = true, string indicating on which side of the widget the tick should be displayed. One of "bottom", "top", "left", "right".

args.name: html
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") The content of the widget. HTML tags supported.

args.name: bgcolor
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") The color of the background of the widget.

args.name: event_size
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "event_stream") The size of the events in the widget. Either "s" (small, title only) or "l" (large, full event).

args.name: sizing
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "image") The preferred method to adapt the dimensions of the image to those of the widget. One of "center" (center the image in the tile), "zoom" (zoom the image to cover the whole tile) or "fit" (fit the image dimensions to those of the tile).

args.name: margin
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "image") The margins to use around the image. Either "small" or "large".

args.name: env
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The environment to use.

args.name: service_service
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The trace service to use.

args.name: service_name
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The name of the service to use.

args.name: size_version
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The size of the widget. One of "small", "medium", "large".

args.name: layout_version
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The number of columns to use when displaying values. One of "one_column", "two_column", "three_column".

args.name: must_show_hits
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display hits.

args.name: must_show_errors
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display errors.

args.name: must_show_latency
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display latency.

args.name: must_show_breakdown
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display breakdown.

args.name: must_show_distribution
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display distribution.

args.name: must_show_resource_list
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display resources.

args.name: display_format
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") The display setting to use. One of "counts", "list", or "countsAndList".

args.name: color_preference
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") Whether to colorize text or background. One of "text", "background".

args.name: hide_zero_counts
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") Boolean indicating whether to hide empty categories.

args.name: manage_status_show_title
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") Boolean indicating whether to show a title.

args.name: manage_status_title_text
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") The title of the widget.

args.name: manage_status_title_size
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") The size of the widget's title.

args.name: manage_status_title_align
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") The alignment of the widget's title. One of "left", "center", or "right".

args.name: columns
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "log_stream") Stringified list of columns to use. Example: "[\"column1\",\"column2\",\"column3\"]"

args.name: logset
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "log_stream") ID of the logset to use.

args.name: time
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "toplist", "event_timeline", "event_stream", "alert_graph", "check_status", "trace_service", "log_stream") Nested block describing the timeframe to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given widget.

args.name: tile_def
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "hostmap", "change", "toplist", "process") Nested block describing the content to display in the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given widget.

args.name: params
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") Nested block describing the monitors to display. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given widget.

args.name: live_span
args.description: (Required) The timeframe to use when displaying the widget. One of "10m", "30m", "1h", "4h", "1d", "2d", "1w".

args.name: sort
args.description: (Optional) The method to use to sort monitors. Example: "status,asc".

args.name: text
args.description: (Optional) The query to use to get monitors. Example: "status:alert".

args.name: count
args.description: (Optional) The number of monitors to display.

args.name: start
args.description: (Optional) The start of the list. Typically 0.

args.name: viz
args.description: (Required) Should be the same as the widget's type. One of "timeseries", "query_value", "hostmap", "change", "toplist", "process".

args.name: request
args.description: (Required) Nested block describing the request to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple request blocks are allowed within a given tile_def block.

args.name: marker
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries") Nested block describing the marker to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple marker blocks are allowed within a given tile_def block.

args.name: event
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries") Nested block describing the event overlays to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given tile_def block.

args.name: custom_unit
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") The unit for the value displayed in the widget

args.name: autoscale
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") Boolean indicating whether to automatically scale the tile.

args.name: precision
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") The precision to use when displaying the tile.

args.name: text_align
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") The alignment of the text.

args.name: node_type
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") The type of node used. Either "host" or "container".

args.name: scope
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") The list of tags to filter nodes by.

args.name: group
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") The list of tags to group nodes by.

args.name: no_group_host
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") Boolean indicating whether to show ungrouped nodes.

args.name: no_metric_host
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") Boolean indicating whether to show nodes with no metrics.

args.name: style
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") Nested block describing how to display the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given tile_def block.

args.name: palette
args.description: (Optional) Color set to use to display nodes. One of "green_to_orange", "yellow_to_green", "YlOrRd" (warm), "hostmap_blues" (cool).

args.name: palette_flip
args.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating whether to flip how the hostmap is rendered. For example, with the default palette, low values are represented as green, with high values as orange. If palette_flip is "true", then low values will be orange, and high values will be green.

args.name: fill_min
args.description: (Optional) Metric value corresponding to minimum color fill.

args.name: fill_max
args.description: (Optional) Metric value corresponding to maximum color fill.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) How the marker lines will look. Possible values are {"error", "warning", "info", "ok"} {"dashed", "solid", "bold"}. Example: "error dashed".

args.name: value
args.description: (Required) Mathematical expression describing the marker. Examples: "y > 1", "-5 < y < 0", "y = 19".

args.name: label
args.description: (Optional) A label for the line or range.

args.name: q
args.description: (Required) The search query for event overlays.

args.name: q
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", "change", "hostmap") The query of the request. Pro tip: Use the JSON tab inside the Datadog UI to help build you query strings.

args.name: type
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "hostmap") Choose the type of representation to use for this query. For widgets of type "timeseries" and "query_value", use one of "line", "bars" or "area". For widgets of type "hostmap", use "fill" or "size".

args.name: query_type
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") Use "process".

args.name: metric
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") The metric you want to use for the widget.

args.name: text_filter
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") The search query for the widget.

args.name: tag_filters
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") Tags to use for filtering.

args.name: limit
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") Integer indicating the number of hosts to limit to.

args.name: aggregator
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") The aggregator to use for time aggregation. One of "avg", "min", "max", "sum", "last".

args.name: compare_to
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") Choose from when to compare current data to. One of "hour_before", "day_before", "week_before" or "month_before".

args.name: change_type
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") Whether to show absolute or relative change. One of "absolute", "relative".

args.name: order_by
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") One of "change", "name", "present" (present value) or "past" (past value).

args.name: order_dir
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") Either "asc" (ascending) or "desc" (descending).

args.name: extra_col
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") If set to "present", displays current value. Can be left empty otherwise.

args.name: increase_good
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") Boolean indicating whether an increase in the value is good (thus displayed in green) or not (thus displayed in red).

args.name: style
args.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", "process") describing how to display the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given request block.

args.name: conditional_format
args.description: (Optional) Nested block to customize the style if certain conditions are met. Currently only applies to Query Value and Top List type graphs.

args.name: template_variable
args.description: (Optional) Nested block describing a template variable. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple template_variable blocks are allowed within a datadog_screenboard resource.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The variable name. Can be referenced as $name in graph request q query strings.

args.name: prefix
args.description: (Optional) The tag group. Default: no tag group.

args.name: default
args.description: (Optional) The default tag. Default: "*" (match all).

args.name: palette
args.description: (Optional) Color of the line drawn. For widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", one of: "classic", "cool", "warm", "purple", "orange" or "gray". For widgets of type "process", one of: "dog_classic_area", "YlOrRd", "GnBu", "Reds", "Oranges", "Greens", "Blues", "Purples".

args.name: width
args.description: (Optional) Line width. Possible values: "thin", "normal", "thick". Default: "normal".

args.name: type
args.description: (Optional) Type of line drawn. Possible values: "dashed", "solid", "dotted". Default: "solid".

args.name: palette
args.description: (Optional) Color scheme to be used if the condition is met. One of: "red_on_white", "white_on_red", "yellow_on_white", "white_on_yellow", "green_on_white", "white_on_green", "gray_on_white", "white_on_gray", "custom_text", "custom_bg", "custom_image".

args.name: comparator
args.description: (Required) Comparison operator. Example: ">", "<".

args.name: value
args.description: (Optional) Value that is the threshold for the conditional format.

args.name: color
args.description: (Optional) Custom color (e.g., #205081).

args.name: invert
args.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating whether to invert color scheme.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID of this screenboard in your Datadog account. The web interface URL to this screenboard can be generated by appending this ID to https://app.datadoghq.com/screen/

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) Synthetics test type (api or browser)

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name of Datadog synthetics test

args.name: message
args.description:
(Required) A message to include with notifications for this synthetics test.
Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same '@username' notation as events.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Required) A list of tags to associate with your synthetics test. This can help you categorize and filter tests in the manage synthetics page of the UI.

args.name: request
args.description:
(Required)


method - (Required) DELETE, GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, PATCH, POST, PUT (noop if type=browser)

url - (Required) Any url

timeout - (Optional) For type=api, any value between 0 and 60 (Default = 60). No-op for type=browser

body - (Optional) Request body

args.name: method
args.description: (Required) DELETE, GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, PATCH, POST, PUT (noop if type=browser)

args.name: url
args.description: (Required) Any url

args.name: timeout
args.description: (Optional) For type=api, any value between 0 and 60 (Default = 60). No-op for type=browser

args.name: body
args.description: (Optional) Request body

args.name: request_headers
args.description: (Optional) Header name and value map

args.name: assertions
args.description:
(Required) Array of 1 to 10 items, only some combinations of type/operator are valid (please refer to Datadog documentation)


type - (Required) body, header, responseTime, statusCode

operator - (Required) Please refer to Datadog documentation as operator depend on assertion type

target - (Required) Expected value, please refer to Datadog documentation as target depend on assertion type

property - (Optional) if assertion type is "header", this is a the header name

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) body, header, responseTime, statusCode

args.name: operator
args.description: (Required) Please refer to Datadog documentation as operator depend on assertion type

args.name: target
args.description: (Required) Expected value, please refer to Datadog documentation as target depend on assertion type

args.name: property
args.description: (Optional) if assertion type is "header", this is a the header name

args.name: options
args.description:
(Required)


tick_every - (Required) 900, 1800, 3600, 21600, 43200, 86400, 604800 plus 60 if type=api or 300 if type=browser

follow_redirects - (Optional) true or false

min_failure_duration - (Optional) Grace period during which a synthetics test is allowed to fail before sending notifications

min_location_failed - (Optional) Threshold below which a synthetics test is allowed to fail before sending notifications

args.name: tick_every
args.description: (Required) 900, 1800, 3600, 21600, 43200, 86400, 604800 plus 60 if type=api or 300 if type=browser

args.name: follow_redirects
args.description: (Optional) true or false

args.name: min_failure_duration
args.description: (Optional) Grace period during which a synthetics test is allowed to fail before sending notifications

args.name: min_location_failed
args.description: (Optional) Threshold below which a synthetics test is allowed to fail before sending notifications

args.name: locations
args.description: (Required) Please refer to Datadog documentation for available locations (e.g. "aws:eu-central-1")

args.name: device_ids
args.description: (Optional) "laptop_large", "tablet" or "mobile_small" (only available if type=browser)

args.name: status
args.description: (Required) "live", "paused"

attrs.name: public_id
attrs.description: ID of the Datadog synthetics test

args.name: title
args.description: (Required) The name of the dashboard.

args.name: description
args.description: (Required) A description of the dashboard's content.

args.name: read_only
args.description: (Optional) The read-only status of the timeboard. Default is false.

args.name: graph
args.description: (Required) Nested block describing a graph definition. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple graph blocks are allowed within a datadog_timeboard resource.

args.name: title
args.description: (Required) The name of the graph.

args.name: viz
args.description: (Required) The type of visualization to use for the graph. Valid choices are "change", "distribution", "heatmap", "hostmap", "query_value", timeseries", and "toplist".

args.name: request
args.description: Nested block describing a graph definition request (a metric query to plot on the graph). The structure of this block is described below. Multiple request blocks are allowed within a graph block.

args.name: events
args.description: (Optional) A list of event filter strings. Note that, while supported by the Datadog API, the Datadog UI does not (currently) support multiple event filters very well, so use at your own risk.

args.name: autoscale
args.description: (Optional) Boolean that determines whether to autoscale graphs.

args.name: precision
args.description: (Optional) Number of digits displayed, use * for full precision.

args.name: custom_unit
args.description: (Optional) Display a custom unit on the graph (such as 'hertz')

args.name: text_align
args.description: (Optional) How to align text in the graph, can be one of 'left', 'center', or 'right'.

args.name: style
args.description: (Optional) Nested block describing hostmaps. The structure of this block is described below.

args.name: group
args.description: (Optional) List of groups for hostmaps (shown as 'group by' in the UI).

args.name: include_no_metric_hosts
args.description: (Optional) If set to true, will display hosts on hostmap that have no reported metrics.

args.name: include_ungrouped_hosts
args.description: (Optional) If set to true, will display hosts without groups on hostmaps.

args.name: node_type
args.description: (Optional) What nodes to display in a hostmap. Can be one of 'host' (default) or 'container'.

args.name: scope
args.description: (Optional) List of scopes for hostmaps (shown as 'filter by' in the UI).

args.name: yaxis
args.description: (Optional) Nested block describing modifications to the yaxis rendering. The structure of this block is described below.

args.name: marker
args.description: (Optional) Nested block describing lines / ranges added to graph for formatting. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple marker blocks are allowed within a graph block.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) How the marker lines will look. Possible values are {"error", "warning", "info", "ok"} {"dashed", "solid", "bold"}. Example: "error dashed".

args.name: value
args.description: (Required) Mathematical expression describing the marker. Examples: "y > 1", "-5 < y < 0", "y = 19".

args.name: label
args.description: (Optional) A label for the line or range. Warning: when a label is enabled but left empty through the UI, the Datadog API returns a boolean value, not a string. This makes terraform plan fail with a JSON decoding error.

args.name: min
args.description: (Optional) Minimum bound for the graph's yaxis, a string.

args.name: max
args.description: (Optional) Maximum bound for the graph's yaxis, a string.

args.name: scale
args.description: (Optional) How to scale the yaxis. Possible values are: "linear", "log", "sqrt", "pow##" (eg. pow2, pow0.5, 2 is used if only "pow" was provided). Default: "linear".

args.name: q
args.description: (Required) The query of the request. Pro tip: Use the JSON tab inside the Datadog UI to help build you query strings.

args.name: aggregator
args.description: (Optional) The aggregation method used when the number of data points outnumbers the max that can be shown.

args.name: stacked
args.description: (Optional) Boolean value to determine if this is this a stacked area graph. Default: false (line chart).

args.name: type
args.description: (Optional) Choose how to draw the graph. For example: "line", "bars" or "area". Default: "line".

args.name: style
args.description: (Optional) Nested block to customize the graph style.

args.name: conditional_format
args.description: (Optional) Nested block to customize the graph style if certain conditions are met. Currently only applies to Query Value and Top List type graphs.

args.name: fill_max
args.description: (Optional) Maximum value for the hostmap fill query.

args.name: fill_min
args.description: (Optional) Minimum value for the hostmap fill query.

args.name: palette
args.description: (Optional) Spectrum of colors to use when styling a hostmap. For example: "green_to_orange", "yellow_to_green", "YlOrRd", or "hostmap_blues". Default: "green_to_orange".

args.name: palette_flip
args.description: (Optional) Flip how the hostmap is rendered. For example, with the default palette, low values are represented as green, with high values as orange. If palette_flip is "true", then low values will be orange, and high values will be green.

args.name: template_variable
args.description: (Optional) Nested block describing a template variable. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple template_variable blocks are allowed within a datadog_timeboard resource.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The variable name. Can be referenced as $name in graph request q query strings.

args.name: prefix
args.description: (Optional) The tag group. Default: no tag group.

args.name: default
args.description: (Optional) The default tag. Default: "*" (match all).

args.name: palette
args.description: (Optional) Color of the line drawn. For example: "classic", "cool", "warm", "purple", "orange" or "gray". Default: "classic".

args.name: width
args.description: (Optional) Line width. Possible values: "thin", "normal", "thick". Default: "normal".

args.name: type
args.description: (Optional) Type of line drawn. Possible values: "dashed", "solid", "dotted". Default: "solid".

args.name: palette
args.description: (Optional) Color scheme to be used if the condition is met. For example: "red_on_white", "white_on_red", "yellow_on_white", "white_on_yellow", "green_on_white", "white_on_green", "gray_on_white", "white_on_gray", "custom_text", "custom_bg", "custom_image".

args.name: comparator
args.description: (Required) Comparison operator. Example: ">", "<".

args.name: value
args.description: (Optional) Value that is the threshold for the conditional format.

args.name: custom_fg_color
args.description: (Optional) Used when palette is set to custom_text. Set the color of the text to a custom web color, such as "#205081".

args.name: custom_bg_color
args.description: (Optional) Used when palette is set to custom_bg. Set the color of the background to a custom web color, such as "#205081".

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID of this timeboard in your Datadog account. The web interface URL to this timeboard can be generated by appending this ID to https://app.datadoghq.com/dash/

args.name: access_role
args.description: (Optional) Role description for user. Can be st (standard user), adm (admin user) or ro (read-only user).  Default is st.

args.name: disabled
args.description: (Optional) Whether the user is disabled

args.name: email
args.description: (Required) Email address for user

args.name: handle
args.description: (Required) The user handle, must be a valid email.

args.name: is_admin
args.description: (Deprecated) (Optional) Whether the user is an administrator. Warning: the corresponding query parameter is ignored by the Datadog API, thus the argument would always trigger an execution plan.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name for user

args.name: role
args.description: (Deprecated) Role description for user. Warning: the corresponding query parameter is ignored by the Datadog API, thus the argument would always trigger an execution plan.

attrs.name: disabled
attrs.description: Returns true if Datadog user is disabled (NOTE: Datadog does not actually delete users so this will be true for those as well)

attrs.name: verified
attrs.description: Returns true if Datadog user is verified
